Total number of FEC errors detected (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCFECErrors
parameter.description:
Total number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTURHECErrors
parameter.description:
Total number of HEC errors detected (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCHECErrors
parameter.description:
Total number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTURCRCErrors
parameter.description:
Total number of CRC errors detected (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCCRCErrors
parameter.description:
Total number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

object.name: Device.DSL.Channel.{i}.Stats.Showtime.
object.description:
This object contains DSL channel statistics accumulated since the most recent DSL Showtime {{bibref|G.997.1}}.
Note: The {{object}} parameters SHOULD NOT be reset when the interface statistics are reset via an interface disable / enable cycle.

parameter.name: XTURFECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of FEC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCFECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTURHECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of HEC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCHECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTURCRCErrors

Number of CRC errors detected since the most recent DSL Showtime (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCCRCErrors
parameter.description:
Number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C since the most recent DSL Showtime (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

object.name: Device.DSL.Channel.{i}.Stats.LastShowtime.
object.description:
This object contains DSL channel statistics accumulated since the second most recent DSL Showtime {{bibref|G.997.1}}.
Note: The {{object}} parameters SHOULD NOT be reset when the interface statistics are reset via an interface disable / enable cycle.

parameter.name: XTURFECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of FEC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCFECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the second most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTURHECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of HEC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCHECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the second most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

Number of CRC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCCRCErrors
parameter.description:
Number of CRC errors detected by the ATU-C since the second most recent DSL Showtime (CV-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

object.name: Device.DSL.Channel.{i}.Stats.CurrentDay.
object.description:
This object contains DSL channel statistics accumulated during the current day {{bibref|G.997.1}}.
Note: The {{object}} parameters SHOULD NOT be reset when the interface statistics are reset via an interface disable / enable cycle.

parameter.name: XTURFECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of FEC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCFECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of FEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the second most recent DSL Showtime (FEC-CFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTURHECErrors
parameter.description:
Number of HEC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-P as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).

Number of HEC errors detected by the ATU-C since the second most recent DSL Showtime (HEC-PFE as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).

parameter.name: XTURCRCErrors
parameter.description:
Number of CRC errors detected since the second most recent DSL Showtime (CV-C as defined in ITU-T Rec. {{bibref|G.997.1}}).
Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

parameter.name: XTUCCRCErrors
parameter.description:

Note: If the parameter is implemented but no value is available, its value MUST be 4294967295 (the maximum for its data type).

object.name: Device.DSL.Channel.{i}.Stats.QuarterHour.
object.description:
This object contains DSL channel statistics accumulated during the current quarter hour {{bibref|G.997.1}}.
Note: The {{object}} parameters SHOULD NOT be reset when the interface statistics are reset via an interface disable / enable cycle.

object.name: Device.DSL.BondingGroup.{i}.
object.description:
DSL bonding group table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}). Each instance is a bonding group, and is expected to be stacked above a {{object|#.Channel}} instance or a {{object|##.FAST.Line}} instance for each bonded channel in the group.
Many of the parameters within this object, including {{param|LowerLayers}}, are read-only because bonding is not expected to be configured by a Controller.
The DSL bonding data model is closely aligned with {{bibref|TR-159}}. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondingGroup''.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description:
Enables or disables the bonding group.
This parameter is based on ''ifAdminStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description:
The current operational state of the bonding group (see {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.2}}). {{enum}}
When {{param|Enable}} is {{false}} then {{param}} SHOULD normally be {{enum|Down}} (or {{enum|NotPresent}} or {{enum|Error}} if there is a fault condition on the interface).
When {{param|Enable}} is changed to {{true}} then {{param}} SHOULD change to {{enum|Up}} if and only if the interface is able to transmit and receive network traffic; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Dormant}} if and only if the interface is operable but is waiting for external actions before it can transmit and receive network traffic (and subsequently change to {{enum|Up}} if still operable when the expected actions have completed); it SHOULD change to {{enum|LowerLayerDown}} if and only if the interface is prevented from entering the {{enum|Up}} state because one or more of the interfaces beneath it is down; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|Error}} state if there is an error or other fault condition detected on the interface; it SHOULD remain in the {{enum|NotPresent}} state if the interface has missing (typically hardware) components; it SHOULD change to {{enum|Unknown}} if the state of the interface can not be determined for some reason.
This parameter is based on ''ifOperStatus'' from {{bibref|RFC2863}}.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the bonding group as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the bonding group entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description:
{{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.
{{param}} is read-only for this object because bonding is expected to be configured by the CPE, not by the Controller.

parameter.name: GroupStatus

enumeration.description: Local device received a "dying gasp" message (preceding a loss-of-power) from the peer device
Operating bonding scheme of the peer port is different from the local one
Upstream or downstream data rate is at or below threshold

parameter.name: GroupID
parameter.description: DSL bonding group ID. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondingGroup.aGroupID''.

parameter.name: BondSchemesSupported
BondScheme
parameter.description: Currently operating bonding scheme. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''aGroupOperBondScheme''.

parameter.name: GroupCapacity
RunningTime
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} for which this bonding group has been operationally up. Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|section 11.4.2}} ''Group Running Time''.

parameter.name: TargetUpRate
TargetDownRate
ThreshLowUpRate
parameter.description: Threshold upstream data rate in {{units}} for this DSL bonding group. {{param|GroupStatus}} will include {{enum|LowRate|GroupStatus}} whenever the upstream rate is less than this threshold. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondingGroup.aGroupThreshLowUpRate''.

parameter.name: ThreshLowDownRate
parameter.description: Threshold downstream data rate in {{units}} for this DSL bonding group. {{param|GroupStatus}} will include {{enum|LowRate|GroupStatus}} whenever the downstream rate is less than this threshold. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondingGroup.aGroupThreshLowDownRate''.

parameter.name: UpstreamDifferentialDelayTolerance
parameter.description: The maximum upstream differential delay in {{units}} among member links in a bonding group. Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|section 11.4.1}} ''Differential Delay Tolerance''.

parameter.name: DownstreamDifferentialDelayTolerance
parameter.description: The maximum downstream differential delay in {{units}} among member links in a bonding group. Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|section 11.4.1}} ''Differential Delay Tolerance''.

parameter.name: BondedChannelNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}} Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondingGroup.aGroupNumChannels''.

object.name: Device.DSL.BondingGroup.{i}.BondedChannel.{i}.
object.description:
DSL bonded channel table. Each table entry represents a bonded channel within the bonding group, and is associated with exactly one {{object|##.Channel}} instance or one {{object|###.FAST.Line}} instance. There MUST be an instance of {{object}} for each DSL channel or FAST line that is bonded.
When a {{object|##.Channel}} or {{object|###.FAST.Line}} is no longer bonded, then the CPE MUST delete the corresponding {{object}} instance. However, when a bonded {{object|##.Channel}} or {{object|###.FAST.Line}} becomes disabled, the channel remains bonded and so the corresponding {{object}} instance MUST NOT be deleted.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description:
{{reference}}This is the channel that is being bonded.
This is read-only because bonding is expected to be configured by the CPE, not by the Controller.

object.name: Device.DSL.BondingGroup.{i}.BondedChannel.{i}.Ethernet.
object.description: Per-channel {{bibref|G.998.2}} Ethernet-based bonding parameters.

object.name: Device.DSL.BondingGroup.{i}.BondedChannel.{i}.Ethernet.Stats.
object.description:
Per-channel {{bibref|G.998.2}} Ethernet-based bonding statistics.
These relate to the {{bibref|G.998.2}} PME (Physical Medium Entity) Aggregation Function (PAF) lower layer (per-channel) interfaces.
The CPE MUST reset the Stats parameters either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|###.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|###.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: UnderflowErrorsSent
parameter.description: Number of underflow errors sent, i.e. on the transmit side of the interface.

parameter.name: CRCErrorsReceived
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors received, i.e. on the receive side of the interface.

parameter.name: AlignmentErrorsReceived
parameter.description: Number of alignment errors received, i.e. on the receive side of the interface.

parameter.name: ShortPacketsReceived
parameter.description: Number of short packets received, i.e. on the receive side of the interface.

parameter.name: LongPacketsReceived
parameter.description: Number of long packets received, i.e. on the receive side of the interface.

parameter.name: OverflowErrorsReceived
parameter.description: Number of overflow errors received, i.e. on the receive side of the interface.

parameter.name: PauseFramesReceived
parameter.description: Number of pause frames received, i.e. on the receive side of the interface.

parameter.name: FramesDropped
parameter.description: Number of frames dropped, e.g. because the receive queue is full.

object.name: Device.DSL.BondingGroup.{i}.Stats.
object.description:
Throughput statistics for this interface.
The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.

parameter.name: TotalStart
parameter.description:
DSL-specific statistic. The Number of {{units}} since the beginning of the period used for collection of {{object|Total}} statistics.
Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this might not always be possible.
Note: {{param}} SHOULD NOT be reset when the interface statistics are reset via an interface disable / enable cycle.

parameter.name: CurrentDayStart
parameter.description:
DSL-specific statistic. The Number of {{units}} since the beginning of the period used for collection of {{object|CurrentDay}} statistics.
The CPE MAY align the beginning of each CurrentDay interval with days in the UTC time zone, but is not required to do so.
Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this might not always be possible.
Note: {{param}} SHOULD NOT be reset when the interface statistics are reset via an interface disable / enable cycle.

parameter.name: QuarterHourStart
parameter.description:
DSL-specific statistic. The Number of {{units}} since the beginning of the period used for collection of {{object|QuarterHour}} statistics.
The CPE MAY align the beginning of each QuarterHour interval with real-time quarter-hour intervals, but is not required to do so.
Statistics SHOULD continue to be accumulated across CPE reboots, though this might not always be possible.
Note: {{param}} SHOULD NOT be reset when the interface statistics are reset via an interface disable / enable cycle.

object.name: Device.DSL.BondingGroup.{i}.Stats.Total.
object.description:
Total statistics for this bonding group.
Note: The {{object}} parameters SHOULD NOT be reset when the interface statistics are reset via an interface disable / enable cycle.

parameter.name: FailureReasons
parameter.description:
{{list}} Indicates the failure conditions that have occurred during the accumulation period. {{enum}}
Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|section 11.4.3}} ''Current Group Failure Reason''.

parameter.name: UpstreamRate
parameter.description: The achieved upstream data rate in {{units}} (which might change subject to dynamic link usage conditions). Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|section 11.4.2}} ''Achieved Aggregate Data Rate''.

parameter.name: DownstreamRate
parameter.description: The achieved downstream data rate in {{units}} (which might change subject to dynamic link usage conditions). Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|section 11.4.2}} ''Achieved Aggregate Data Rate''.

parameter.name: UpstreamPacketLoss
parameter.description: The total number of upstream packets that were lost at aggregation output from a bonding group during the accumulation period. Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|section 11.4.2}} ''Group Rx Cell Loss Count''.

parameter.name: DownstreamPacketLoss
parameter.description: The total number of downstream packets that were lost at aggregation output from a bonding group during the accumulation period. Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|section 11.4.2}} ''Group Rx Cell Loss Count''.

parameter.name: UpstreamDifferentialDelay
parameter.description: The achieved upstream differential delay in {{units}} (which might change subject to dynamic link usage conditions).

parameter.name: DownstreamDifferentialDelay
parameter.description: The achieved downstream differential delay in {{units}} (which might change subject to dynamic link usage conditions).

parameter.name: FailureCount
parameter.description: The number of times that the group was declared ''Unavailable'' during the accumulation period. Corresponds to {{bibref|G.998.1|Section 11.4.3}} ''Group Failure Count''.

parameter.name: ErroredSeconds
SeverelyErroredSeconds
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} during which the group was declared ''SeverelyErrored'' during the accumulation period. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondingGroup.aGroupPerf**SES''.

parameter.name: UnavailableSeconds
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} during which the group was declared ''Unavailable'' during the accumulation period. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondingGroup.aGroupPerf**UAS''.

object.name: Device.DSL.BondingGroup.{i}.Ethernet.
object.description: Ethernet-based bonding parameters {{bibref|G.998.2}}.

object.name: Device.DSL.BondingGroup.{i}.Ethernet.Stats.
object.description:
{{bibref|G.998.2}} Ethernet-based bonding statistics.
These relate to the {{bibref|G.998.2}} PME (Physical Medium Entity) Aggregation Function (PAF) and to its upper layer interface. PAF lower layer interface statistics are in the {{object|##.BondedChannel.{i}.Ethernet.Stats}} objects.
The CPE MUST reset the Stats parameters either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|##.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled) or when the interface becomes administratively up (i.e. the interface's {{param|##.Enable}} parameter transitions from {{false}} to {{true}}). Administrative and operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: PAFErrors
parameter.description: Number of PAF errors. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondETH.aEthRxErrors''.

parameter.name: PAFLargeFragments

parameter.name: PAFLostEnds
parameter.description: Number of PAF Lost End events. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondETH.aEthRxLostEnds''.

parameter.name: PAFOverflows
parameter.description: Number of PAF Overflow events. Corresponds to {{bibref|TR-159}} ''oBondETH.aEthRxOverflows''.

parameter.name: PauseFramesSent
parameter.description: Number of pause frames sent, i.e. on the transmit side of the interface.

parameter.name: CRCErrorsReceived
parameter.description: Number of CRC errors received, i.e. on the receive side of the interface.
